instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used on classifying peach varieties?
Output: The research used visual near-infrared (VIS-NIR) diffuse reflectance spectra between 350 and 820 nm to classify peach varieties.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on classifying peach varieties?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used on classifying peach varieties included denoising, baseline correction, and wavelength selection.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the detection method on classifying peach varieties?
Output: The metric used on classifying peach varieties was classification accuracy.

instruction: How was the one-dimensional convolutional neural network used in the research on classifying peach varieties based on VIS-NIR spectra?
Output: In the research on classifying peach varieties based on VIS-NIR spectra, a one-dimensional convolutional neural network (CNN) was used. The CNN was constructed and trained using a VIS-NIR spectra database containing five kinds of peaches. The network model obtained through training was then employed to predict the testing set data. The accuracy of the models based on deep learning, specifically the one-dimensional CNN, reached 100% in the validation dataset and 94.4% in the test dataset. This indicates that the CNN was successful in distinguishing peach varieties using VIS-NIR spectroscopy.

instruction: How does the accuracy of the models based on deep learning compare to traditional methods in classifying peach varieties using VIS-NIR spectroscopy?
Output: The accuracy of the models based on deep learning in classifying peach varieties using VIS-NIR spectroscopy is higher compared to traditional methods. The past study states that the accuracy of the deep learning models reached 100% in the validation dataset and 94.4% in the test dataset. This indicates that the deep learning approach outperformed traditional methods in accurately distinguishing peach varieties.
